snippet: Scientific data show that Greenland’s continental shelf is connected to a ridge beneath the Arctic Ocean, giving Denmark a claim to the North Pole and any energy resources beneath it, Denmark’s foreign minister has said.
abstract: Danish Foreign Minister Martin Lidegaard says data shows Greenland's continental shelf is connected to ridge beneath Arctic Ocean, giving country claim to North Pole and any energy resources beneath it.
lead_paragraph: Scientific data show that Greenland’s continental shelf is connected to a ridge beneath the Arctic Ocean, giving Denmark a claim to the North Pole and any energy resources beneath it, Denmark’s foreign minister has said.

headline.main: Denmark: A Claim to the North Pole
headline.print_headline: Denmark: A Claim to the North Pole
